channel.title: Free Flowing Rivers on Free-flowing Rivers
channel.description: Recent content in Free Flowing Rivers on Free-flowing Rivers

item.title: 1 Introduction
2 Requirements
item.description: The python scripts in this repository require third-party modules to run such as: the source code requires that the software ArcGIS 10.5.1 or newer is installed. ArcGIS provides essential python interfaces, such as arcpy, as well as other frameworks such as numpy and pandas, upon which the code relies on heavily. The python interpreter must be set to the one provided by the ArcGIS installation. The scripts use an EXCEL workbook as input, and as such, require either Microsoft Excel, or LibreOffice the ArcGIS 64-bit geoprocessing module may be beneficial depending on the data volume.

item.title: 3 Input data
item.description: A typical Free-flowing Rivers assessment must have four essential files: 3.1 Stream network The feature class streams, which contains the river network, with the essential attributes to conduct the FRA. The stream network provides information for all 6 pressure indicators, the presence of waterfalls, as well as floodplain densities. For a description of the stream network and its attributes please see the technical documentation in the figshare repository at https://doi.

item.title: 4 Python modules
item.description: The structure of this repository is composed of a starting script, and a set of 5 modules, each of which contain a set of python files. The following elements are described here: the python file fra_start.py: A starting script that triggers the assessment the module CONFIG: An Excel file that is used to provide paths and parameters for the assessment the module SCRIPTS: A module with scripts for automating the processing of scenarios the module INDICES: A module with algorithms to calculate the indices (DOF, DOR, SED, DOM, STA) the module STATS: A module to calculate statistics, and to conduct the benchmarking the module TOOLS: A helper module with geoprocessing tools 4.

item.title: 5 Results
item.description: 5.1 Launching the assessment The main script is the starting point for every model run. The main script reads the parameter and scenario settings from the excel file, prepares output folders and files; executes the defined processing steps. Run the starting script fra_start.py from the commandline or through the PyCharm environment. 5.2 Results The model generates two types of results: Tabular data in the form of an Excel workbook with several worksheets.
